Mono JIT compiler version 4.2.1 (Stable 4.2.1.102/6dd2d0d Wed Dec  2 14:02:16 PST 2015)

data.title: Fix: Upgrading Extensions Blows Up
data.body:
Fixes #1111

@alexandrudima, would be great to get a second pair of eyes in this, mind reviewing? We can do a live code review in Lync, if you want.

Here are my intended changes:
- The **extension service** should install each extension to a path containing the extension's version. Example: `.vscode/extensions/joaomoreno.uuid-0.0.2`.
- The `scanPlugin` call should only return the latest extension version, in case there are multiple versions of the same extension installed, per extension folder (global vs user).
- The **extension service** should clean up old extension versions in the user's extension folder, on startup. Currently set to run once 5 seconds after startup.
- The **list extensions** action should only display the latest version of an extension.

This also needs extensive testing, which I will do through today.

data.title: [css] cssParser incomplete for at-rules

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Few of issues Iâ€™ve seen in the parser for at-rules:
- @supports flagged as unknown at-rule. https://drafts.csswg.org/css-conditional-3/#at-supports . This is supported by all browsers now.
- @-ms-keyframes isn't flagged. This never existed. It is added [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/languages/css/common/parser/cssParser.ts#L480) . There is a note below saying it [doesn't exist](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/languages/css/common/parser/cssParser.ts#L487) but this code doesn't seem to do anything. Removing L480 above fixes it, but I don't know if there should be a more specific error message to show that the prefix was never needed and thus is redundant?
- For @viewport the method is named _parseMSViewPort instead of _parseViewPort, and only includes the -ms- version. Opera Presto (so Opera Mini still) [supports @-o-viewport](https://dev.opera.com/articles/an-introduction-to-meta-viewport-and-viewport/) and it is a good idea to allow the unprefixed version for forwards compatibility. It is supported behind a flag in Chrome/Opera 15+.
- Same issue as above for @document, except the method name is named more generically.
- @counter-style missing. Supported by Firefox (33+). This could hit the two browser rule, but @document is included.
- Same as above for  @font-feature-values. Firefox 34+.

of the new ones, @supports is probably the most critical to fix as it is widely supported now and we'd like to promote it as a better alternative to UA detection for CSS.

Most of these including all @keyframes also don't syntax highlight properly (beyond general broken CSS highlighting in the insider release), but I can look to fix that in CSS.plist separate from this.

data.body:

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12825770/11834847/f57dce96-a40a-11e5-90ff-9c8f33ea05c6.png)

var fun1 = new Function("return 1 + 2; // in fun1"); // break point
var fun2 = new Function("return 3 + 4; // in fun2");
var r = fun1(); // the folow will step in code of fun1 if step in at this line
r = fun2(); // will step in code of fun1 if step in at above line, else step in code in fun2
console.info("r = " + r); // but the result is valid

data.title: Keyboard shortcut to navigate Working files
data.body:
It will be great to have a keyboard shortcuts / commands to access the `Working files`.
Navigate `Working files`, remove from `Working files`.

data.title: Debug Call Stack viewport vertical scroll cuts off the bottom item
data.body:
In debug mode, in the Call Stack viewport, whenever the list is larger than the view area and the vertical scrollbar appears, the bottom item is not reachable by scrolling.

Note that even with multiple threads, it cuts off exactly one item.

The same is not true for the variables viewport, the variables viewport works correctly.

data.title: Add invokeSnippetForCurrentWord command.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi guys, thank you for your amazing tool.

Here's the rationale: when typing code and knowing that there is a snippet, the code completion combo actually hinders the typing process.

This command allows filling in the snippets immediately, by picking the first available potential suggestion that is a snippet, without the full combo autocomplete round trip.

data.title: Odd keybindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I currently have these in my user `keybindings.json`:

```
[
    { "key": "ctrl+down", "command": "editor.action.moveLinesDownAction",
                             "when": "editorTextFocus" },
    { "key": "ctrl+up",   "command": "editor.action.moveLinesUpAction",
                             "when": "editorTextFocus" }
    { "key": "ctrl+i",    "command": "expandLineSelection",
                             "when": "editorTextFocus" },
]
```

ctrl+up and ctrl+down are standard are used in [atom](https://github.com/nwinkler/atom-keyboard-shortcuts#editing) (similar product to vscode) and used as ctrl+shift+up and ctrl+shift+down in sublime text. Any chance these can at least be bound to something?

Also regarding ctrl+l, it is the default for selecting a line in atom editor as well as sublime text. Could this be changed from ctrl+i to match this?

data.title: Make mock-debug a yeoman generator, publish /common as NPM module

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The whole process of cloning mock-debug to make a debugger extension and then changing it is cumbersome. Like for normal extensions, there should be a yeoman generator that asks you questions about what languages the debugger is for, what the name should be etc.

Secondly, in the docs you express the intent to move the common part of the mock-debug repo to a NPM module, which makes sense, as it's the TS implementation of the debugger protocol so we can write extensions in TS using it. You would be able to add more features over time etc.

I think this would make writing debugger extensions more straight forward.

data.title: Extensibility API: openTextDocument() inconsistent dirty state with working files if document is inside workspace.rootPath
data.body:
Sorry for the convoluted title, also sorry if this is simply user error or misuse of the API.

Long story short, I'm opening the TextDocument like this:

```
vscode.workspace.openTextDocument(vscode.Uri.parse("untitled:" + lsFullpath)).then(...);
```

where lsFullpath is a full path inside vscode.workspace.rootPath, and immediately call

```
TextDocument.save()
```

This has the intended effect (which might be the API misuse) that a new file (and required non-existent subfolders) is created in the workspace.

However, the working files now have the new file with a dirty marker.

Also, browsing to the file in the workspace (not working files) and opening in the editor and changing it creates a 2nd entry in working files, obviously also dirty at this point.

Saving the file removes dirty marker from the 2nd entry in working files, but changes are not propagated to the 1st entry.

Now selecting 1st entry in working files and saving it kicks out 2nd entry from working files, and overwrites the file (which I guess is to be expected).

This came up trying for a quick solution for #1169

data.title: Update path when renaming the parent of a dirty file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When you rename any parent directory of a file you are currently editing, you lose access to the file. You can regain access to it by changing the name of the directory back to what it was before the rename.

I would expect VS Code to move the file you are editing to the new folder even if it is not saved.

I am on version 0.10.3.

data.title: Close dialog for new files Don't Save and Cancel are swapped
data.body:
Run VS Code with a new filename ('code blah.txt').
Start to close VS Code and you will be prompted to Save, Don't Save or Cancel.
Click Don't Save - The prompt is gone but VS Code is still running.
Click Cancel - VS Code quits and the new file is lost.
It appears that Don't Save and Cancel have swapped handlers?

data.title: Typescript suggestions are very often broken
data.body:
Hi,

Typescript suggestions are always out of sync whenever any change like a git operation happens. 
For someone like me who relies on the terminal, the experience is horrible.
If I understand it correctly, it's caused by changes to files outside the IDE. "atom-typescript" had a sync button to fix this. You should too.

If it's relevant, I'm using VSCode version 0.10.3 with Typescript v1.7.3 on OSX 10.11.2.

data.title: Comments in a .json file should be highlighted as invalid syntax

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
A JSON structure [cannot contain comments](http://stackoverflow.com/a/4183018/1864167). However when you create a `.json` file and insert something like this:

``` json
{
    "TEST": "Some value", // some comment
}
```

it will highlight the `// some comment` part as a comment. For `.js` files this should be okay but for `.json` files it hides the issue that you can't use a comment in that location.

It would be helpful if the highlighting could be dropped and even be highlighted as a syntax error.

data.title: Whenever I do any type of git operation I lose typescript intellisense
data.body:
Visual Studio Code 0.10.3
Whenever I do any type of git operation I lose type script suggestions. 

It used to only happen when i move branches, but now even a commit makes me lose intellisense. Fiddling with the tsconfig.json brings it back sometimes. Other times the tsconfig.json is locked by VSCode. I know its VSCode because when I close the application the file becomes unlocked.

Also, tsconfig randomly gets deleted.

Reload window does not help. Restarting VSCode does not help. Restarting my pc does not help. Reinstalling the tsd does not help. Reinstalling code does not help.

My repository is here: https://github.com/tonyeung/angular-typescript-seed
